meanings.definition: Consisting of or displaying only one color.
meanings.sent1: The room was monochromic, with everything painted in shades of blue.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a monochromic painting using only shades of gray.
meanings.sent3: The monochromic outfit made him look like a walking rainbow in a black-and-white world.
meanings.sent4: Her monochromic design philosophy brought a sense of calm and simplicity to the room.
meanings.sent5: The monochromic sunset painted the sky in a serene palette of pinks and purples.

meanings.definition: A work of art using only one color.
meanings.sent1: The gallery featured a stunning monochromic by a famous artist.
meanings.sent2: She admired the monochromic hanging in the museum, captivated by its simplicity.
meanings.sent3: The monochromic on the wall seemed to change shades as the light shifted throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: His monochromic was a masterpiece of minimalism, drawing viewers in with its singular focus.
meanings.sent5: The monochromic in the exhibit stood out among the colorful paintings, commanding attention with its stark beauty.

meanings.definition: A photograph or picture developed in black and white or in varying tones of only one color.
meanings.sent1: The photographer's monochromic captured the essence of the city in shades of gray.
meanings.sent2: She framed the monochromic of the old bridge, highlighting its timeless beauty.
meanings.sent3: The monochromic of the forest looked like a scene from a dream, with shadows dancing in shades of green.
meanings.sent4: His monochromic of the city skyline was a study in contrasts, showcasing the play of light and dark.
meanings.sent5: The monochromic of the flower garden brought out the delicate details in shades of pink and white.
